name: SearchDatadogIncidents
description:
Search for incidents in Datadog by query.

Use this tool to find incidents in Datadog that match a specific query. It helps in quickly retrieving relevant incident information based on search criteria.

parameters.name: incident_query
parameters.description: Query to determine which incidents to return. Use facets joined by `AND` and multiple values by `OR`, e.g., `state:active AND severity:(SEV-2 OR SEV-1)`.

value_schema.description:
Specifies which incidents should be returned. The query can contain any number of incident facets
joined by `ANDs`, along with multiple values for each of those facets joined by `OR`s. For
example: `state:active AND severity:(SEV-2 OR SEV-1)`.

parameters.name: include_related_objects
parameters.description: Specifies which types of related objects ('users', 'attachments') should be included in the response.

value_schema.description: Specifies which types of related objects should be included in the response.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Defines the order of returned incidents. Use 'created' for ascending and '-created' for descending.

value_schema.description: Specifies the order of returned incidents.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Specify the number of incidents to return per page. The maximum allowed value is 100.

value_schema.description: Size for a given page. The maximum allowed value is 100.

parameters.name: page_offset
parameters.description: The starting position offset for returning incidents. Use an integer value.

value_schema.description: Specific offset to use as the beginning of the returned page.
